firstRunNote.message:
This is a pre-release version of Interstellar Armada: Galactic Ace, a browser-based 3D space combat simulator by Kriszti√°n Nagy.

Please note that the game is under development - nothing is final, features are missing, there can be bugs and performance problems.

The game collects and reports anonymous statistics that are used for development purposes only (such as balancing difficulty or focusing on the most used features) and are not linked to any personal information or IP address. This can be turned off in the settings.

If you like the game, check out the {facebook} page, where you can stay updated about the progress of the game's development!

Thank you for trying it out and enjoy!
firstRunNote.messageWeb: For the best results please use the latest {chrome} (or Chromium) browser, as in the tests so far it has outperformed all other browsers significantly, and it is the only one with proper 3D sound. (the game doesn't rely on any Chrome-specific technology, so this might change in the future)

releaseNotes.general: The game has been updated to version {version} since you last played. Here is what's new:
releaseNotes.noNews: Please visit {github} to view the changes!
releaseNotes.0.4.3:
• Energy shields are added to spacecrafts, which regenerate their power over time
  • Lots of tweaks to controls and related mechanics for better feel and accuracy
  • HUD tweaks and features, some of which can be toggled from the settings
  • Removed 5 static missions, added 3 dynamic missions, rebalanced and tweaked the remaining missions
  • The player's equipment details are visible on the mission selection screen
  • Difficulty levels affect more mechanics
  • Fixed white flickering on some phone browsers
  • Fixed explosion graphics color issue
  • Lots of updates to the game editor
releaseNotes.0.4.4:
• The game now collects anonymous statistics, which can be turned off in the settings
  • Added new settings, such as preferred views, to the new Gameplay (former HUD) settings menu
  • Added markers to ships that need to be destroyed/protected as mission objectives
  • Added a marker and special color for ships that are transmitting the displayed message
  • HUD messages / transmissions appear with an animation
  • AI fighters now start evasive maneuvers with a short delay (reaction time)
  • Small HUD tweaks and improvements
  • Fixed loud menu sounds
  • Fixed new hostiles message incorrectly appearing at times
  • Fixed infinite targeting when the last two enemies were destroyed in rapid succession
  • The game editor now displays properties for missions
releaseNotes.0.4.5:
• Added the "Heavy duty" mission featuring the new Rhino heavy fighter
  • Fix for the upcoming Chrome change of not allowing automatic sound playback
  • Made dust particles more visible
  • Fixed broken shadows after shadow resolution is changed
  • Greatly reduced model file sizes, decreasing downloading and loading times
  • Lots of performance optimizations, the game runs smoother and uses less memory
releaseNotes.0.4.6:
• Added missiles and a missile tutorial mission
  • Responsive menu layouts using the whole screen
  • Added experimental touchscreen controls
  • Custom missions can be created and loaded
  • Difficulty levels affect more mechanics
  • Added two new music tracks
  • Updated backgrounds
  • Optimized game files for smaller size and faster loading
  • Performance optimizations
  • Major improvements in the Interstellar Armada Editor
  • Many additional tweaks and fixes for the menus, HUD and graphics
releaseNotes.0.5.0:
• New mission: "Hide and seek"
  • New spacecrafts: Piranha interceptor and Communications Relay
  • Added basic multiplayer support
  • Support for uploading and playing custom missions created by players
  • Better gamepad support
  • Many improvements for the Interstellar Armada Editor and for mission creation
  • Ships now have sensors with limited range
  • Support for locking the mouse pointer during the game
  • Smaller model files
  • A couple of other smaller fixes
releaseNotes.0.5.1:
• Added collision detection between spacecrafts
  • Many optimizations to ensure the performance is at least the same as before the collision detection was added
  • Can handle a larger number of sound effects
  • Fixed wrong profile being applied when a gamepad is detected
  • Fixed hits not being detected at close range
  • New unique sound effect for the Communications Relay
  • Several important fixes and small improvements to the Interstellar Armada Editor
releaseNotes.0.5.2:
• Added the "Holding out" mission featuring the new Stingray pirate bomber
  • Added a basic tutorial for the Interstellar Armada Editor
  • Fixed optional mission event conditions not working
  • Distance based mission objectives can now refer to multiple spacecrafts
  • The Editor now suggests the translatable squad names
releaseNotes.0.5.3:
• Added a cooperative game mode to multiplayer games
  • Small balancing tweaks to make some missions (particularly "The rebel corvette" and "Hide and seek") a bit easier
  • Major usability improvements for the mission editor: spacecrafts can be selected for editing by clicking them in the preview; spacecrafts that jump in based on anchors now also show in the preview; new button icons and better tooltips; popups can be moved by dragging them with the mouse
releaseNotes.0.5.4:
• New mission: "The siege"
  • New spacecrafts: Athens station and Sentinel sentry gun platform
  • Turrets don't fire if they are blocked by their own ship
  • Weapons now rotate in the target view
  • Statistics tracking for community missions (the submitter can see them)
  • Added a touch control overview screen for devices with a touchscreen
  • Showing game version, FPS counter and popup at mission start can be disabled in the settings
  • Launch demo button hidden by default, can be re-enabled in the settings
  • Smaller model files and performance optimizations
  • Several fixes, especially for mobile devices
  • Numerous usability improvements and fixes for the Interstellar Armada Editor
  • 3 new chapters added to the Interstellar Armada Editor tutorial

firstMultiRunNote.message:
This is a very early preview version of the multiplayer feature of the game. It has only extremely basic functionality, and if you choose to try it out, expect bugs, performance problems, lag, jittering, desynchronization, disconnects and other issues! The performance can be improved if you play on the same local network, because in this case the game host will connect to the other players directly, not through the server.

At the moment, all games are public, private games cannot be created!

The chat in the game lobby room is not moderated, please stay civil and respectful towards other players! Do not share any personal or sensitive information through your player name or in the chat! The game developer does not take responsibility for any player behaviour or messages you may encounter here. Enter at your own risk!

missions.noSelectedDescription: Choose a mission from the list.
missions.customDescription: Select a mission file created in the {editor} to play it. Please note that using custom resources, classes or environment in the mission is not yet supported.
missions.missionHubDescription:
Here you can play missions submitted by players to the Mission Hub or submit your own custom missions. The game developer will review your submitted mission and if it is approved, it will appear in the list on the left. The minimum requirements for a mission to be approved:
  • it must have a unique title
  • it must have a description that does not contradict what happens during the mission
  • it must have a piloted spacecraft
  • it must have mission objectives that can be completed
  • it must not not have so many spacecrafts that it compomises performance
  • it must use an environment and classes (spacecraft, equipment etc) that are included in the game by default
  • it must not produce any errors when loaded
Meeting these criteria does not guarantee that the mission will be approved, the final decision is made by the developer if the mission is interesting enough to be accepted.

winObjective.countBelow: Less than {count} out of {subjects} must remain

loseObjective.destroy: At least one ship of {subjects} must survive
loseObjective.countBelow: At least {count} out of {subjects} must survive
loseObjective.maxHullIntegrity: At least one ship of {subjects} must survive with more than {maxIntegrity}% integrity
loseObjective.maxHullIntegrityAny: {subjects} must survive with more than {maxIntegrity}% integrity
loseObjective.maxHullIntegrityOne: {subjects} must survive with more than {maxIntegrity}% integrity

missions.submitMissionAcceptTerms: I have read and accept the {linkBegin}terms{linkEnd}
missions.submitMissionHelp:
Here you can submit missions created by yourself to the Mission Hub to be reviewed by the game developer (me, Kriszti√°n Nagy). See the My missions screen to create and test your own missions!

Username: Enter the nickname under which you want to publish your missions. This will be visible for all players. Do not use personal information! Use the same name that you set in the editor as the author of the mission. The username must be between {minNameLength} and {maxNameLength} characters long.

Password: To verify that two missions came from the same user, you must enter the same password to submit multiple missions under the same name. For security, do not use the same password that you use for important online services (email, banking etc). I do not collect email addresses, so this password can not be recovered if lost! The password must be between {minPasswordLength} and {maxPasswordLength} characters long.

Comment: Add any notes here that you would like me to know about the mission. Do not include personal information! This will be only visible to me, not to other players. The information you want to share with players about the mission should go in the description field of the mission.

Mission file: Select a .json file that you have created with the game editor and that meets the criteria listed on the main Community missions screen. The file must not be larger than {maxFileSize}.

multiGames.title: Multiplayer
multiGames.noAvailableGamesLabel: There are no available games right now.
multiGames.disconnectMessage: Connection to the game server has been closed.
multiGames.cannotConnectMessage: Cannot connect to the game server.
multiGames.playerNameAlreadyExistsError: Error: Game already has a player with the same name!
multiGames.gameNameAlreadyExistsError: Error: A game with the same name already exists!
multiGames.invalidTextError: Error: Invalid text message! Message not sent.
multiGames.serverIsFullError: Cannot connect to the game server: Server is currently full!
multiGames.incompatibleApiVersionError: Cannot connect to the game server: Game server version ({serverVersion}) not compatible with this client ({clientVersion})!
multiGames.noWelcomeError: Cannot connect to the game server: No welcome message received!

multiLobby.title: Multiplayer
multiLobby.hostLeftMessage: The host has left the game.
multiLobby.kickedMessage: You have been kicked out of the game by the host.
multiLobby.playerKickedMessage: {name} has been kicked out of the game by the host!

restartDialog.message: Are you sure you want to abort the mission and restart it? The current progress will be lost.

quitDialog.message: Are you sure you want to abort the mission and quit? The mission will count as failed.

quitMultiDialog.message: Are you sure you want to leave the game?

messages.welcome: Welcome to the target practice tutorial!
messages.targetIndicator:
Good job!
The next target is automatically selected. It is marked by a red reticle, or by an arrow if it is not visible in front of you. Its details are displayed in the top right corner of your HUD.
messages.move:
This container is farther away. Move ({controlStrings/keyboard/forward}/{controlStrings/keyboard/reverse}) closer to it to get a better aim. Your speed is shown on the right.
Destroy it when you are close enough!
messages.targeting:
You can also switch targets manually.
({controlStrings/keyboard/nextNearestHostileTarget} / mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/nextNearestHostileTarget} / joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/nextNearestHostileTarget})
Destroy another container!
messages.impactIndicators: The green crosshairs show the estimated positions where your shots will hit or miss your current target.
messages.views:
Try switching between different views! ({controlStrings/keyboard/nextView}/{controlStrings/keyboard/previousView})
Hold {controlStrings/keyboard/controlCamera} and turn to look around in cockpit view.
messages.destroyContainers: Destroy the rest of the containers!
messages.cruise1: We brought in some unarmed drones. Switch to cruise flight mode ({controlStrings/keyboard/toggleCruise}) to engage them. In this mode, you are allowed to move faster, but your turn rate is restricted at high speed.
messages.cruise2: Cruise flight mode is ideal for engaging or intercepting targets that are far away. Once you are close, switch back to combat mode ({controlStrings/keyboard/toggleCruise}) for better maneuverability.
messages.aimAssist: The small red reticle shows where you need to aim to hit a moving target.
messages.speedHolding: Press {controlStrings/keyboard/toggleSpeedHolding} to toggle maintining current speed. While on, pressing {controlStrings/keyboard/forward}/{controlStrings/keyboard/reverse} will change the speed, pressing {controlStrings/keyboard/resetSpeed} will set a full stop.
messages.targetingFriendly:
A friendly drone has arrived.
You can target non-hostile spacecrafts with {controlStrings/keyboard/nextNearestNonHostileTarget} or mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/nextNearestNonHostileTarget}.
messages.controls: You can always check and modify the full set of controls in the control settings which you can reach from the menu. ({controlStrings/keyboard/quit})
messages.finish: Destroy the rest of the drones to complete this mission! You can see the number of remaining enemies on the left.

messages.unarmed: This first drone is unarmed. Destroy it and we will send in armed drones.
messages.hullBar: Destroy this armed drone before it destroys you! The state of your ship's armor is shown on the left. The greener the better!
messages.strafe:
More drones incoming!
Don't stay in one place, strafe ({controlStrings/keyboard/strafeLeft}, {controlStrings/keyboard/strafeRight}, {controlStrings/keyboard/raise}, {controlStrings/keyboard/lower}) to avoid incoming fire!
messages.finish: Destroy these final drones to finish the training!

messages.shield: Now you are equipped with a shield. It can absorb a few shots, and recharges after a short time.
messages.missiles: You also have a few homing missiles. Once they are locked, press {controlStrings/keyboard/launchMissile} / mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/launchMissile} / joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/launchMissile} to launch one.
messages.finish: Destroy the remaining targets to finish the training!

messages.rubyBladeArrived: He's here! Ignore the guards! Quick, target the Ruby Blade, destroy it and let's get out of here!

messages.start: Engaging enemy fighters! Watch out for incoming turret fire!
messages.deltaArrived: The cavalry has arrived! We're engaging the Dnieper!
messages.hostileFightersArrived: A new group of hostile fighters! Alpha squad, cover us!

messages.tutorialSwitchMissile:
Switch to SM-4 small missiles ({controlStrings/keyboard/changeMissile} or joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/changeMissile}).
Wait for target lock and detroy the drone!
(press {controlStrings/keyboard/launchMissile} / mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/launchMissile} / joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/launchMissile} to launch)
messages.tutorialTorpedo:
Switch back to your torpedoes (LT-3b) to take down the corvette.
Torpedoes are less accurate and more limited in numbers, but do massive damage.
messages.tutorialSalvo:
Small missiles can be launched quickly in salvos.
(press {controlStrings/keyboard/toggleSalvo} or joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/toggleSalvo} to toggle)
Use this to take down more armored or numerous fighters.
messages.tutorialSalvo2: Missiles in one salvo always home in on the same target, but you can lock on to the next one in the meantime.

messages.hostileFightersArrived: We're dealing with those escorts! Delta squad, you can proceed to the Dniester!
messages.dniesterGettingClose: The Dniester is getting close! Delta squad, you need to engage it quickly! Fly in cruise mode to get there faster.
messages.dniesterDestroyed: Great job! Now let's clean up the remaining escorts!

messages.bomberWave1: Incoming bombers! Alpha squad, take them down quickly!
messages.bomberWave2: More bombers! Intercept them before they get close!

messages.fighterWave1: Enemy fighters incoming! Alpha, take them out! We're proceeding towards the enemy corvette.
messages.bomberWave1: Hostile bombers jumped in! Cover me, Alpha squad!
messages.bomberWave2: Another wave of bombers! Alpha, you know what to do!
messages.allWavesClear: Good job, Alpha squad! I'm taking care of it from here. Stand clear and watch the show!

messages.hostileFrigatesArrived: They've got heavy firepower! Send in the bombers!
messages.betaArrived: Beta squad have arrived, engaging frigates! Cover us, Alpha squad!
messages.hostileBombersArrived: We're under attack from enemy bombers!
messages.danubeDestroyed: We've lost the Danube! Alpha squad, we need cover from those bombers!

messages.caution: [color:0,1,0,1]Mission control[]: Nice work taking out the bombers! Now stay clear of the Mississippi and let the frigates do their job.

messages.firstCorvetteArrived: The first corvette is here, watch out for turret fire!
messages.bombersArrived: Beta leader here, we have arrived and are engaging the enemy!

messages.start1: These are the coordinates we extracted from the pirate data files. Looking for the relay...
messages.start2: No sign of the relay, but the sensors are picking up some buoys. The pirates must be using these to navigate in the nebula. Follow the buoys to see if they lead to the relay!
messages.patrol: Picking up a pirate patrol coming your way! You must be getting closer to the relay!
messages.relayDetected: The sensors are picking up the relay! Approach it to begin the hacking process!
messages.hackingEnd: Hacking successful! Protect the relay until we can locate the pirate base!
messages.almostWin: Almost located the base, just 30 more seconds!
messages.win: We've got the base coordinates! Well done!

messages.start: Quickly! Take them out before the rest arrives!
messages.overkill2: They have to give us a promotion after this!

messages.start: All looks clear, just 4 fighters patrolling the station. Waiting for the Elba.
messages.elba: Alright, people, who wants to watch some fireworks? Approaching the station!
messages.elbaDown: The Elba is down! We need a new plan! Alpha, destroy all enemy fighters and bombers!
messages.fightersApproach: The pirate fighters are starting to approach!
messages.tooClose: You're getting too close! Get away from the station!
messages.fightersDown1: Good job, Alpha! All fighters and bombers are destroyed. We have found a new way to deal with the station.
messages.fightersDown2: We dispatched a wing of bombers, but they are short on torpedoes. You will have to take care of the sentries to give them a clear line of attack at the station.
messages.fightersDown3: Once all sentries are gone, we will send them in.
messages.dontFlyStraight: Careful, don't fly in a straight line!
messages.sentriesDown: All sentries down, get away from the station!
messages.epsilon: Epsilon wing reporting! We're engaging the station!

messages.test:
This is a test mission. Fly around and do as you please.
This reminder will be displayed 3 times.
messages.test2: You can freely destroy other spacecrafts.

message.ready:
Ready!
During the game, press the {menuKey} key to open the menu, where you can also check and adjust the controls.
message.victory:
All mission objectives have been completed!
Activate your jump engines ({controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut}) to conclude the mission.
message.fail:
You have failed one of the mission objectives!
Activate your jump engines ({controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut}) to conclude the mission.

defeat.message: You ship has been destroyed. What would you like to do?

jump.engaged:
JUMP ENGINES ENGAGED
Aligning velocity...

Press {controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut} to cancel
jump.preparing:
JUMP ENGINES ENGAGED
Preparing...
{timeLeft}
Press {controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut} to cancel

multi.allPlayersLeftMessage: All players have left the game!
multi.connectionTimeout: Your connection to the host has timed out!

description.victory: You have earned {performance} medal for your performance in this mission.
description.nextPerformance: Achieve a performance score of {score} or more to earn a higher level distinction.
description.fail: You did not manage to complete all the objectives for this mission.
description.defeat: Your spacecraft has been destroyed during the mission.
description.leftEarly: You left the battlefield before completing all the mission objectives.

about.title: About
about.aboutGameParagraph: An open source game developed by Kriszti√°n Nagy, with the aim to combine the depth of classic desktop space combat simulators with the convenience of browser games. The longer term goal is to create a mission based, non-linear gameplay experience, where upon the completion of each mission, several new ones are dynamically, prodecurally generated and offered for the player.
about.aboutGameDevParagraph: The game is work-in-progress, and in this early version many planned features are missing and you might encounter numerous bugs. If you would like to follow the development of the game, like the {facebook} page or watch the project on {github}. If you have any ideas or feedback you would like to share, feel free to contact the creator in {email}.
about.licenseNote: Find detailed attribution and licensing information at the bottom of the page.
about.creditsFreesoundNote: Some sound effects based on samples by the following freesound.org users:
about.creditsOtherSoundsNote: Some sound effects based on a sample by
about.creditsSoundLicenseNote: click here for sound effect attribution and licensing details
about.usedSoftwareParagraph: This game is created using freely available and/or open source software and open standards. For creating the in-game assets, {inkscape}, {blender}, {gimp}, {audacity}, {bfxr}, {lmms}, {fontforge} and specialized tools developed (in {netbeans} and {lazarus}) by Kriszti√°n Nagy are used, and the game itself is being developed using {netbeans}, {git}, {npm}, {grunt}, {sass}, {chrome} and {firefox}, all of these running on {ubuntu}. Some handy Netbeans plugins also support the development: {eslint}, {python}, GLSL Syntax Highlighter.
about.licenseParagraph:
The source code of the game (HTML, Javascript, CSS source files, JSON files containing game configuration and accompanying text files) is created by Kriszti√°n Nagy and released under the {license} license, except for the included {requireJS} library, about which see {requireJSLicense}.

About the license of the fonts used in game see: {sansation} (by Bernd Montag), {aldrich} and {audiowide} (from the Google Fonts library). Some modifications to Aldrich were made by Kriszti√°n Nagy, detailed in the {fontlog} file.

The images, 3D models, textures and music files were all created by Kriszti√°n Nagy and are released under the {assetLicense} license. Regarding the sound effects, click {soundLicense} for detailed licensing and attribution information.
about.licenseElectronParagraph: This version of the game has been packaged with the {electron} framework, which is available under {electronLicense}.

generalSettings.title: General settings
generalSettings.analyticsNote: No personal information is included in the reports, only statistics of feature usage and in-game performance with a random generated ID. Please help the development by keeping this option turned on.

gameplaySettings.title: Gameplay settings
gameplaySettings.targetHealthAtCenter: Target integrity bar always at center:
gameplaySettings.demoViewSwitching: Automatic view switching in demo mode:
gameplaySettings.showReadyMessage: Show ready message at the start of missions:

controls.title: Controls
controls.noController: No controllers detected. If you have controllers plugged in, try pressing the buttons on them and wait a few seconds for them to be detected.

actionDescriptions.stopTime: Stop the time in the game, with controls still available
actionDescriptions.toggleDevInfoVisibility: Toggle the visibility of version information and framerate
actionDescriptions.toggleCruise: Toggle between cruise and combat flight modes
actionDescriptions.toggleFlightAssist: Toggle flight assist (between combat and free flight modes)
actionDescriptions.changeFlightMode: Switch to the next flight mode
actionDescriptions.nextNearestNonHostileTarget: Target the next non-hostile (friendly or neutral) spacecraft
actionDescriptions.toggleSalvo: Toggle salvo mode for active missiles
actionDescriptions.toggleSpeedHolding: Toggle speed holding (in assisted flight modes)
actionDescriptions.resetSpeed: Reset speed to zero (when holding speed)
actionDescriptions.jumpOut: Engage jump engines and leave the battlefield
actionDescriptions.controlCamera: Hold this button to control the camera instead of your spacecraft if you have the same controls assigned
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveLeft: Move the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveRight: Move the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveUp: Move the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveDown: Move the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveForward: Move the camera forward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveBackward: Move the camera backward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnLeft: Turn the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnRight: Turn the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnUp: Turn the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnDown: Turn the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollLeft: Roll the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollRight: Roll the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraDecreaseFOV: Zoom in (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraIncreaseFOV: Zoom out (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.nextView: Change to the next view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.previousView: Change to the previous view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.resetView: Reset the current view to its original state

tip.tryControls: Try the different (mouse, keyboard, joystick) controls to see which one suits you best.
tip.changeControls: You can change the controls during the game if they don't suit you.
tip.tryViews: Try different flight views to see which works for you best.
tip.prioritizeTargets: Always target and eliminate the most important threats first.
tip.think: Take the time to evaluate the battle situation between encounters.
tip.curve: Keep moving on a curve to make yourself a difficult target.
tip.strafe: Use strafing to evade projectiles coming from the front.
tip.rollStrafe: Rolling and strafing together is an effective evasive maneuver.
tip.cruiseMode: Switch to cruise mode to engage targets that are far away.
tip.combatMode: Strafing is only allowed in combat mode, use it in close encounters.
tip.protect: Keep an eye on the state of spacecrafts you need to protect.
tip.protectTaunt: You can lure enemies away from your teammates by hitting them.
tip.turretDistance: Keep your distance from enemy ships with turrets.
tip.scoreDestroy: The final hit that destroys an enemy is worth more score points.
tip.friendlyFire: Don't rush in front of your teammates as they can hit you from behind.
tip.effectiveness: Focus on enemies against which your spacecraft is effective.
tip.interceptors: Interceptors are effective against all types of fighters and bombers.
tip.bombers: Bombers are effective against small warships.
tip.corvettes: Corvettes are effective against interceptors and other fighters.
